ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: my calculus abilities
I learned some new math skills and how to make a good "cheat sheet" for math tests
How to calculate area and volume of shapes
I learned about calculus and math concepts.
A lot of foundations to calculus II
I learned methods of integration, approximation with Riemann sums, the use of polar coordinates and parametric curves, and the approximation of functions with Taylor series, among other topics.
In this class, the material covered is integrals and integration strategies, convergence/divergence of series, power and Taylor series, areas between curves in carterisan polar and parametric forms.
I developed knowledge about integral calculus as well as how introductory mathematics are taught at Yale College.
Learned integration strategies and series/sequence evaluation. Also polar and parametric equations.
calculus, reinforcement of trigonometry, a lot of critical thinking and algebra as well
critical thinking, calculus

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
strengths:
- course is organized quite well
- really like the explorations on canvas nad thought the problem sets and assessments were challenging but manageable.
weaknesses:
- find it insane that for $83,000 worth of tuition and fees at Yale we are not taught by professors and instead by graduate students. 
- my TA did not seem comfortable or experienced with teaching

The strengths were there were lots of resources on the canvas page. I was neutral about most things but maybe some weaknesses are that we just did the same thing every week so it got kind of boring but that is usually what happens in a basic math class
A lot of pests, not much practice that isnt graded

Strength was that it had very helpful review sessions and the homework had crucial feedback. I liked that the homework problems were similar to ones we covered in class or would see on tests. A weakness would be how the lectures were structured.

Strengths: Hayou Wang was very attentive to student inquires and learning in his sections. Weekly problem sets, explorations, and peer tutoring hours were also very helpful in solidifying that understanding. I particularly liked that explorations had multiple attempts, so as to make the pre-section learning experience stress-free and engaging.

Weaknesses: none
This course was very fast-paced and structured, which I liked.

I thought that the course was pretty well organized with each lecture being relatively clear and easy to follow. One area for improvement would be for there to be more organization for good practice problems. In reviewing for the exams, I often felt like there were not many practice questions in the textbook when I struggled on a topic
I found the structure and pace of the curriculum to successful facilitate my learning. I did not find the explorations on canvas to be particularly helpful
I think the problem sets and the practice exams were really good. The lecture could be better.

Overall the notes were very helpful. I think the course goes very in depth into the topics so can get very complicated but I appreciate the daily explorations and cheat sheets for the exams because I feel like it is set up to try to encourage understanding and learning for students.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: no, unless it is required to take.

I would only if they liked math or had to take class because it was a little monotonous at times. I would also recommend a good amount of calc experience because I had lots of experience and it was still challenging at times
It needs to be improved
I would recommend it because the concepts we covered are crucial especially if a student is interested in pursuing higher math.
Yes, as it provides a foundational understanding of the material, and there are just many resources at your disposal.
I would recommend this course to any student who wishes to thoroughly understand calculus either for its own sake or for other subjects that draw on it.

I would recommend this course to a peer. While not the perfect math class, it did a good job of teaching me many of the principles to single variable calculus, and, if someone is interested in that field, it is a very solid introduction class.
I would recommend this course to another student who wanted to learn introductory integral calculus.
Yea I mean I guess. If you want to take upper level classes you have to get past this.
Yes, it is a tough course and can be very confusing but you learn a lot of skills.
no I feel like math 115 has been treated as an experimental math course leaving students with not enough guidance in teachers with expertise
